question.questionText: Only one circuit below will light the bulb. Which one will work? Why is that the only circuit that will work?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: That circuit is the only circuit that uses all of the correct contact points.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: One wire needs to be touching the bottom and you can put another wire or battery on the side or the other way around. In this picture a wire is touching the bottom and the D-cell is touching the side.
It is because the wire is touching the right part of the bulb. The electricity is flowing.
The only circuit that will work is A.
The wire is on the D-cell are on the light bulb.
